threads.text: Decent phone, sometimes becomes too sluggish for its specs. Also, not having oleophobic coating is definetely annoying. I like the camera.

It's a good phone but some of the os bugs piss me off. I wish there was a way to have stock android without emui crisp underneath. 
Camera sometimes resets the settings to front camera, when I power on the phone NFC is enabled again without my consent, sometimes when it powers on its in flight mode.. Things like these that make me miss my old nexus 5.

replies.text: trick for NFC (self enabling) .. go to NFC settings .. turn NFC - ON  .. Turn Huawei Beam - OFF .. Turn NFC - OFF .. done .. mostly works

threads.text: And im here with a huawei g6 l11
I don't know... It's a bit overpriced IMO. It has basically the same specs as Honor 9 which is a fair bit cheaper (and I think it's more pretty as well).
EMUI really stops me from giving this a full 10. It holds back what the hardware is truly capable of.
Wanderful

Fingerprint reader
One of my friends managed to unlock it with his finger while checking my phone because he was thinking about buying it...
Has anyone alse experienced it too?

replies.text: Maybe that is the reason why the fingerprint reader is so speedy - it just works incorrectly

threads.text:
Overall it's a pretty good phone if you don't mind emui. It has kinda grown on me and I like the features that comes with it even though I still prefer stock android. Otherwise for the price I got it for it's so much better than the Moto G5S Plus except when it comes to the battery life and the software but that is subjective of course.

Edit: Previous device was Moto G5S Plus hence the mention

Its fast compare to my old iPhone 6. But it's not so stable compare to my older device. 
Its keyboard is a failure, keeps lagging and delay whenever I typed too fast, have to install another keyboard, I know it's quite normal but it really frustrates me

replies.text: I don't use the pre-installed Swype keyboard. My best is Gboard

threads.text: Gboard does his job pretty well and I've tried many of other virtual keyboards but none compare to Gboard.
Probably the fastest phone I've ever had. My last phone galaxy s7 is not match for this beast. 10/10!
Lol mine must be bugged or something. The software is so damn glitchy, the phone keeps lagging for 5 secs like every 2-3 minutes. You guys have any problems with the stability?
My Huawei p8lite VS Huawei p10 consumes a lot of ram memory
Just updated to Oreo. Phone still have stutters here and there just like in Nougat. My other phone (sony xz) is much smoother and feels faster.
Probably only 3rd party apps opening takes some time
Coming from a Lumia 950XL, this phone is so stuttery in web pages I'm beginning to regret my experience in Android. And that is with background apps closed too.☹

I chooses the P10 for my first Android after 9 years of iPhone. The reason was the lack of jailbreak possibility in future iOS versions and the high prices of the iPhones.

So, iOS runs extremely smooth and I never noticed any lags on max. 3 year old models.

In my opinion Huawei did a good job with Huawei.
Scrolling in Chrome works great, Stock launcher and Nova launcher are also very smooth.
Gallery scrolling is without any lags and other animations like multi tasking or open/close animations are buttery smooth as well.

I had a Samsung S7 for 3 weeks before I got my P10 and have to say, that Samsung sucks in this point and others. Nearly every animation is lagging and the whole software feels like the ram is full the whole time.

So initially when purchased it was very smooth, over time it definitely degraded as I installed over 50 apps, most unnecessary. I did a full factory reset, and now its smooth as it was. I think compared to the Galaxy S6 it is definitely smoother (play store especially).
it gets pretty hot when youre shooting at 4k

replies.text:
The CPU an memory will heat up very quick with 4K because auf the live encoding and writing the huge amount of data to memory, it's pretty normal.


I notice heat when using GPS navigation like Sygic or Maps with B164, but that's the only time I can notice this kind of heat.

threads.text: I'm very satisfied with the camera on the p10 phone.

Hi guyz! I just got my P10...all I say about camera- it's a beast. Daylight photos are excelent. For me the "vivid" colour mod makes it 10/10. I've been playing with the camera for all day and I came up with 2 questions:
1)Which resolution do you guys prefer- 12 or 20 mp ??(Since it has only 12 mp colour sensor- does upscaling work good 4 you?)
2)Why software doesnt allow to zoom-in while @20mp at all?

Here's an example for [standart] vs [vivid]- http://imgur.com/a/fg8e6

replies.text: Yes, this problem is mine as well

threads.text: There is an issue with Verical Panorama. Although Horizontal Panorama works perfect, in Vertical as you go up, it gets constantly out of focus. It's hasnt been fixed since B113 and we are now in B162...I have sent the problem to Huawei in all socia media. Try it for yourself
have the phone about a week and thepicture quality is perfect!
Camera does an excellent job on automatic. Love it
P10 has got a magical night mode capture algorithms. Check attached photos below (first 2 taken with moon light only).

replies.text: Yes! I gave that a try and I was impressed. If you have a small tripod it works even better.

threads.text: Overall, very happy with the quality, but please Huawei, give us an option to save RAWs to external storage...

Here some photos from my P10







Cheers!

Vertical panorama is bad.
Bad light bad joins obvious.
Rom version 181.

My samsung s6 camera vertical panorama was perfect

Panorma quality is very poor compared to my old Samsung S6.
The photos are not joined properly.
Very nice selfie camera only one downside it's too zoomed in compared to my last phone galaxy s7. Otherwise no complains

title: Time to take picture (camera launch speed)

threads.text:
a normal 3 to 5 hours screen on time compared to my prev iP6 plus with at least 5.5 hours sot.

With a minimal of camera usage, it will not last more than 4 hours...
Absolute rubbish. I get only 3-4 hours max on my device. Compare to my Moto G 2015 where I had 5-7hours is just not good enough.

replies.text: The same thing happened to me

threads.text: I guess 6-7 hours. Chrome, WhatsApp. I seem to get better battery life using mobile networks. I can't confirm that though.

Aprox 4h SoT. Wifi on, mobile data on, facebook, instagram, facebook messenger lite, whatsapp, internet, game (two dots). Lasts 24 hours without a problem. The relatively short SoT is because TWO DOTS (the game) eats battery pretty well. And from 11PM - 6AM battery consumtion is about 1%-2%.
So I am very happy. 
And I am on L29C432B171 ...no root
Got pretty good sot Whit my p10 , some fb ,g+ internet browsing watching movies and ofc xda reading

I'm satisfied with this phone battery life especially after oreo update. I'm getting 4-5hours SOT after using phone for almost 1,5days~ always. Wifi/4g. Music/snapchat/instagram bla bla. Using a lot off apps for a little bit. Phone is almost 5 months olds
Around 6-7 hours. Chrome, WhatsApp, Telegram, a bit YouTube.

cellular data is mega-important. Rate this thread to express how you think the Huawei P10's LTE performs. A higher rating indicates that it's fantastic: throughput is excellent and signal strength is top-notch.
